title: Esa result?
content: Can anyone tell what an F grade indicates in the provisional result — is it a backlog or just pass?"

comments.body: It's a backlog, you will need to take up a backlog exam in the summer.
It's a backlog , and you can write that exam in the next semester or during summer
why would F - fail mean just pass?
If these are the sort of questions you ask, nobody made a mistake giving you that F
Bro is so cooked he can't even read his grades

If you change "fail" to "just", and simply append a "pass", that's what you get right?

I can definitely see myself being unable to differentiate them
He got good marks in ISA, but after seeing the grade, it looks like they gave 0 marks for ESA
